snippet: Kenan Evren, the 94-year-old former head of the army, and Tahsin Sahinkaya, 86, former commander of air force, face charges of staging a coup to overthrow the civilian government.
abstract: Two former generals stand trial in Ankara for their roles in Turkey’s violent 1980 military coup; Kenan Evren, the former head of the army, and Tahsin Sahinkaya, the former air force commander, face charges of staging a coup to overthrow the civilian government, punishable by life imprisonment; both were absent due to poor health.
lead_paragraph: Kenan Evren, the 94-year-old former head of the army, and Tahsin Sahinkaya, 86, former commander of air force, face charges of staging a coup to overthrow the civilian government.

headline.seo: Kenan Evren and Tahsin Sahinkaya Face Trial in Turkey
headline.main: Turkey: Aging Generals Face Trial for Violent 1980 Military Coup
headline.print_headline: Turkey: Aging Generals Face Trial For Violent 1980 Military Coup

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
